title: The Artist’s Grandmother

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of black chalk and charcoal pencil, with touches of graphite, on grayish-ivory wove paper, laid down on white wove paper.

medium_display: Black chalk and charcoal pencil, with touches of graphite, on grayish-ivory wove paper, laid down on white wove paper
inscriptions: Dated recto, lower right, in graphite: "Dimanche 25 mars 86"
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history: Suzanne Folds McCullagh (ed.), Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 2006), p. 119, cat. 82 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Anvers, Musée Royal des Beaux Arts, "Rétrospective James Ensor," June 16–Aug. 15, 1951, cat. 33.

Kunsthalle Basel, "James Ensor," June 15–Aug. 4, 1963, cat. 117.

Rome, Campidoglio Pallazo dei Conservatori, "Ensor: Dipinti-Disegni-Incisioni," July–Aug. 1981, p. 54, cat. 26.

Tel-Aviv Museum, "James Ensor: 1860–1949," Sept. 22–Nov. 11, 1981, cat. 55.

Zurich, Galerie M. Knoedler, "Gustav Klimt, 1862–1918; Egon Schiele, 1890–1918; James Ensor, 1860–1949; Alfred Kubin, 1877–195: Künstler der Jahrhundertwende," Sept. 24–Dec. 3, 1983, p. 200, cat. 14.

Zurich, Kunsthaus, "James Ensor," May 20–July 31, 1983, p. 354, cat. 214; also Antwerp, Koninklijk Museum voor Schone Kunsten, Aug. 20–Oct. 30.

Art Institute of Chicago, "Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," June 3–July 30, 2006, p. 119, cat. 82 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, "Temptation: The Demons of James Ensor," Nov. 23, 2014-Jan. 25, 2015. also Los Angeles,  J. Paul Getty Museum, June 10-Sep. 7, 2014.
provenance_text: Ernest Rousseau, Brussels; Mme Jeanne Rousseau, Brussels, until at least 1963.  Private Collection, Ostend; Galerie Atelier Ostend, by 1981. Knoedler, Zurich, by 1983; Knoedler, New York.  Sold, Sotheby’s, London, June 27, 1990, lot 301, to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, Brookline, MA; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2013.
